common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues and Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including account linking problems, failure to generate shareable links, and launch failures.  Troubleshooting steps often involve checking log files, resetting account links, and investigating potential conflicts with OneDrive.  A new account linking flow is planned for March 2025 to address some of these issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) is experiencing login problems with their multiple Pieces accounts.
* The accounts were originally registered separately due to a bug in the application.
* User wants to merge existing accounts and have their Google account as the master account.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is cumbersome and not intuitive.
* Potential issue with a capitalization difference in the email address for both accounts on different platforms (GitHub vs. Google).
* Existing auth service provider (being replaced) causes issues with account inconsistencies.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Merging user accounts once the user logs in with their Google or GitHub account.
* Providing additional support via calendar scheduling for a personalized approach.
* Temporarily disabling email privacy settings on GitHub.
* Resetting user's  GitHub account link.
* Implementing a new account linking flow with the new auth service provider in March 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User was able to sign in with their Github account but couldn't link it to their main Google account due to a possible capitalization issue in the email addresses.
* User decided to wait for the implementation of the new account linking flow in March 2025.

**Notes:**

* Issue is open and unresolved.
* User will be notified when the new system is ready for testing.
* New system rollout is expected in March 2025 as part of a larger release and product launch.

related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Issue:** ThemePark is experiencing a problem where they only see an overlay message saying "PiecesOS is not running", making Pieces for VS Code unusable. This happens when trying to launch Pieces or after 10 minutes of use. The overlay is non-dismissable and restarting VS Code or Pieces Desktop doesn't fix it. Only a computer restart resolves the issue, making it highly disruptive.

**Key points raised:**

* ThemePark initially reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on Windows 10. 
* Mack, the Pieces support representative, identified a potential conflict between Pieces Desktop launch on startup and PiecesOS updates.
* ThemePark confirmed they were launching PiecesOS on startup. 
* Additional information revealed the issue occurs with Pieces for VS Code and is not specific to Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack suggested changing the startup application to either Pieces Desktop or removing both from startup to avoid the timing conflict.
* ThemePark explored different startup configurations but the issue persisted.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated. 
* ThemePark provided further details on the issue, including screenshots and the observation that the problem also occurs with VS Code.
* The issue remains unresolved and is causing significant disruption to ThemePark's workflow.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User Rohan Rathi reported issues with both cloud and local LLMs:
    * Cloud: Problems making requests to PiecesOS and cloud services.
    * Local: Trouble with local models.
* Logs requested and uploaded by user.
* Scheduling of call and resolution of both issues.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking requests to PiecesOS.
* Potential hardware constraints for local LLMs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Removal of personal OpenApi key for cloud LLM issue.
* Use of a smaller local LLM for hardware limitations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues resolved.
* Call scheduled for further investigation concluded.

**Additional Notes:**

* Issue for cloud LLMs was identified as a personal OpenApi key not being compatible with the system.
* Local LLM problem may have been due to hardware limitations of Rohan's machine.
* Using a smaller local LLM resolved the issue.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties installing, running, and connecting to Ollama within Pieces OS.  Problems include Cuda errors, installation failures, and conflicts between Pieces OS and external Ollama instances. Solutions involve ensuring proper installation order, troubleshooting network connectivity, and verifying hardware compatibility for local LLMs.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Server Conflicts with Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* User johnkennyuk experienced Cuda errors with Ollama on Pieces OS.
* The issue seemed to stem from conflicting installations and startup order.
* Multiple uninstalls and path cleanups were required to resolve the issue.
* User suggested detecting external Ollama instances to prevent conflicting installations/startup.

**Problems Identified:**

* Cuda errors with Ollama on Pieces OS.
* Conflicting installations of Ollama via winget and Pieces OS.
* Ollama Server not starting reliably due to startup order.
* Unclear interaction between external Ollama instances and Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama using different methods.
* Cleaning up paths and checking environment variables.
* Implementing a change in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address race conditions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved after multiple attempts, but user confirmed it may still occur.
* Further investigation and potential updates are planned.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the challenges of managing software dependencies and ensuring compatibility across different installations and systems.
* The user's feedback and patience were crucial in identifying and addressing the problem.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS crashes and restarts or becomes unresponsive
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS crashing and restarting in a loop, particularly when the Long Term Memory engine is enabled. Others experience unresponsiveness with cloud and local LLMs, requiring a system restart. Proposed solutions include disabling LTM, checking network connectivity, firewall settings, and ensuring sufficient hardware resources for local LLMs.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User Rohan Rathi reported issues with both cloud and local LLMs:
    * Cloud: Problems making requests to PiecesOS and cloud services.
    * Local: Trouble with local models.
* Logs requested and uploaded by user.
* Scheduling of call and resolution of both issues.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking requests to PiecesOS.
* Potential hardware constraints for local LLMs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Removal of personal OpenApi key for cloud LLM issue.
* Use of a smaller local LLM for hardware limitations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues resolved.
* Call scheduled for further investigation concluded.

**Additional Notes:**

* Issue for cloud LLMs was identified as a personal OpenApi key not being compatible with the system.
* Local LLM problem may have been due to hardware limitations of Rohan's machine.
* Using a smaller local LLM resolved the issue.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Issue:** ThemePark is experiencing a problem where they only see an overlay message saying "PiecesOS is not running", making Pieces for VS Code unusable. This happens when trying to launch Pieces or after 10 minutes of use. The overlay is non-dismissable and restarting VS Code or Pieces Desktop doesn't fix it. Only a computer restart resolves the issue, making it highly disruptive.

**Key points raised:**

* ThemePark initially reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on Windows 10. 
* Mack, the Pieces support representative, identified a potential conflict between Pieces Desktop launch on startup and PiecesOS updates.
* ThemePark confirmed they were launching PiecesOS on startup. 
* Additional information revealed the issue occurs with Pieces for VS Code and is not specific to Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack suggested changing the startup application to either Pieces Desktop or removing both from startup to avoid the timing conflict.
* ThemePark explored different startup configurations but the issue persisted.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated. 
* ThemePark provided further details on the issue, including screenshots and the observation that the problem also occurs with VS Code.
* The issue remains unresolved and is causing significant disruption to ThemePark's workflow.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces Desktop App Issues:** Focus on resolving the top reported issue, "Pieces Desktop App Issues and Bugs," particularly account linking problems and launch failures. The planned account linking flow update in March 2025 should be thoroughly tested and implemented effectively.

**Improve PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity:** Address the recurring issues related to PiecesOS launch failures and connectivity problems with cloud services and local LLMs. Investigate OneDrive interference, network configuration issues, and hardware limitations.

**Enhance Ollama Integration Stability:** Investigate and resolve the difficulties users face with Ollama integration, including installation errors, Cuda errors, and conflicts with external Ollama instances. Provide clear guidance on installation order, network connectivity, and hardware requirements.

**Address PiecesOS Crashes and Unresponsiveness:** Investigate and resolve the causes of PiecesOS crashes, restarts, and unresponsiveness, particularly when Long Term Memory is enabled. Explore solutions like optimizing LTM functionality, improving network stability checks, and providing clearer guidance on hardware requirements for local LLMs.

**Proactive Communication and Documentation:**  Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned updates, and troubleshooting steps through clear and timely communication channels. Enhance documentation to cover common issues, FAQs, and detailed solutions related to account linking, Ollama integration, and PiecesOS launch problems.

**Gather Detailed System Information:** During support interactions, collect comprehensive system information from users, including operating system, Pieces OS version, hardware specifications, and relevant log files. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution of issues.

**Consider Hardware Recommendations:**  Given the recurring issues related to local LLM functionality and PiecesOS performance, consider providing users with recommended hardware specifications to ensure optimal performance and minimize compatibility issues.

**Automated Troubleshooting Tools:** Explore developing automated troubleshooting tools or diagnostic scripts that users can run to identify common problems and receive suggested solutions. This can help reduce the load on support staff and provide faster initial support.

**User Feedback Mechanisms:** Implement robust feedback mechanisms to collect user experiences and identify pain points. This can include in-app surveys, feedback forms, and forums where users can share their issues and suggestions.
